Stem: Bluish-green flattened pads 30-60 cm long with no or few short spines. Also develops a sturdy trunk with age.
Flowers: Conspicuous bright yellow, orange or reddish.
FruitSeeds: Succulent egg to oval-shaped berries with tiny spines. May be orange, red or yellow.
Habitat: Pastures, open woodlands, grasslands, rocky slopes.
DistinguishingFeatures: Drooping prickly pear (*Opuntia monacantha*) generally has spines on its pads, and Common prickly pear (*O. stricta) is lower growing.
